author: @CSIMarket
title: DJCO Shines with Stellar Conduct, Despite Earnings Setback in Q4 2023
text: | Sector | | Industry |• Services DJCO Shines with Stellar Conduct, Despite Earnings Setback in Q4 2023 Daily Journal Corporation*s Q4 2023: Revenue Surge Tempered by Unfavorable Earnings Per Share Published Dec 29 2023 / Modified Dec 29 2023 Goran Soko / CSIMarket.com Contributer While the company experienced a 12.169% increase in revenue from the previous year, reaching $21.55 million, it also reported a loss of $-4.71 per share. This is a significant decrease in earnings compared to the previous financial reporting period, where the company saw a revenue improvement of 21.724% from $17.70 million and earnings per share fell from $0.49. In the July to September 30, 2023 financial time-frame, Daily Journal Corporation reported a net shortfall of $-6.485 million. However, this is still an improvement compared to the deficit of $-44.827 million during the same period last year. It is worth mentioning that inventoriesand supplies have increased to $0.1 million, indicating a build-up in stock compared to the previous quarter and the corresponding quarter from the previous year. Daily Journal Corporation's operating earnings fell -6.36% to $3.43 million, resulting in a decrease in the operatingmargin from 19.07% in the fourth quarter of 2022 to 15.92% in the fourth quarter of 2023. Furthermore, there has been a noticeable increase in accounts receivable, which suggests a rise in demand for the company?s products or services. Accounts receivables were valued at $18.7 million, higher than the preceding quarter. On a more positive note, for the financial year 2023, the company announced profitability of $21.45 million and revenue of $67.71 million. This is an improvement from the previous financial year, where Daily Journal Corporation recorded a loss per share of $-54.81 and revenue increased by 25.37% from $54.01 million. Looking ahead, Daily Journal Corporation is expected to release its next financial results on February 12, 2024. This will provide further insight into the company's progress and financial performance. It is essential to analyze these figures comprehensively to understand the overall financial health of Daily Journal Corporation. While the increase in revenue is positive, the significant loss per share and operating margin decrease raise concerns. However, the improved accounts receivable and annual profitability indicate potential growthfor the company. Investors and stakeholders should closely monitor the upcoming financial results to make informed decisions about Daily Journal Corporation's future. author: @Sante_Magazine
title: 86 % des établissements ont déjà vendu de l'alcool à un mineur, un constat alarmant | Santé Magazine
text:
80,6 %, c’est la proportion d’adolescents français de 17 ans qui ont déjà consommé de l’alcool. Malgré une baisse globale de la consommation d’alcool ces dernières années, notamment chez les jeunes de 17 ans, la situation reste préoccupante. L’alcool reste la substance psychoactive la plus répandue parmi les jeunes. Selon une enquête d’Addictions France, cette consommation excessive serait en partie due à la vente d’alcool à des mineurs — pratique pourtant interdite — dans de nombreux établissements (source 1).
Parmi les lieux concernés, on retrouve les grandes surfaces : 90 d’entre elles ont été testées dans les métropoles de Nantes, Angers et Rennes. Sur ce total, seuls huit établissements ont demandé une pièce d’identité avant de refuser la vente. L’enquête pointe également du doigt les bars, cafés et restaurants rapides. Sur 42 établissements testés, un seul a exigé une carte d’identité et a effectivement refusé la vente d’alcool à un mineur.
Les mineurs peuvent encore acheter de l’alcool sans difficulté.
Face à ces chiffres préoccupants, Addictions France a mené plusieurs opérations d’achats-tests entre 2023 et 2025. Malgré l’interdiction légale, l’accès à l’alcool pour les mineurs demeure la norme plutôt que l’exception. Une première enquête, menée entre avril 2023 et avril 2024, a révélé qu’un seul établissement sur l’ensemble des tests avait respecté la loi en refusant de vendre de l’alcool à un mineur après vérification de son âge. Une seconde enquête, réalisée entre avril et mai 2025, montre une légère amélioration : le taux de vente est passé de 93 % en 2021 à 86 %, soit une baisse de 7 points.
Cette baisse reste modeste et montre que la vente d’alcool aux mineurs est encore largement répandue. L’enquête souligne également le manque de vérification systématique de l’âge des clients : seuls 8 % des établissements demandent une pièce d’identité. « On demande parfois les cartes d’identité, mais c’est très rare. Il faut vraiment que le client ait l’air très jeune », confie une serveuse dans un bar nantais.
Une tolérance sociale profondément ancrée
L’enquête révèle aussi qu’acheter de l’alcool quand on est mineur reste relativement simple. Ce constat met en lumière une tolérance sociétale persistante vis-à-vis de la consommation d’alcool chez les adolescents. Qui n’a jamais goûté de l’alcool pour la première fois lors d’un repas familial ? Cette banalisation est ancrée, notamment autour du rôle prétendument « éducatif » de l’initiation à l’alcool. Selon Addictions France, 55 % des Français tolèrent la consommation d’alcool par les adolescents de 15 à 17 ans. L’âge moyen de la première initiation, souvent en famille, est de 14 ans.
« En supermarché, c’est arrivé plusieurs fois. On repose la bouteille, puis on demande à d’autres clients de nous l’acheter. Souvent, ils acceptent », témoigne un mineur interrogé par Addictions France. Ce phénomène traduit une normalisation inquiétante de la consommation d’alcool chez les jeunes, souvent perçue comme inoffensive, notamment dans les contextes sociaux. Addictions France souhaite donc transformer les normes sociales : renforcer les compétences des familles pour aborder la question sans tabou mais avec fermeté, lutter contre la désinformation et responsabiliser tous les acteurs concernés, afin que la protection des mineurs devienne une priorité collective.
94 % des parents jugent inacceptable la vente d’alcool aux mineurs
Si la consommation d’alcool reste bien ancrée dans la culture française, particulièrement chez les adolescents, les parents n’en demeurent pas moins inquiets. Ils sont 94 % à considérer inacceptable la vente d’alcool aux mineurs et souhaitent davantage de contrôles et de sanctions pour les établissements qui enfreignent la loi. Pour ces parents, cela constitue la priorité numéro un afin de réduire ou retarder la consommation d’alcool chez les jeunes.
Face à ce constat alarmant, Addictions France formule plusieurs recommandations concrètes. Les opérations de contrôle devraient devenir systématiques. La mise en place d’un système de contrôles aléatoires et réguliers dans les établissements vendant de l’alcool permettrait de garantir leur conformité. L'association demande également la généralisation des sanctions administratives : avertissements formels en cas d’infraction, puis fermeture administrative temporaire en cas de récidive — allant de quelques jours à plusieurs semaines.

author: Redação
title: Astrônomos alertam sobre poluição luminosa de projeto energético perto de telescópios no Chile
text:
09/01/2025 - 22:21
O Observatório Europeu do Sul (ESO, na sigla em inglês) alertou nesta quinta-feira (9) sobre a ameaça que poderia representar para o funcionamento do observatório Paranal, no norte do Chile, a construção de um projeto para produzir hidrogênio e amoníaco verdes, devido à poluição luminosa.
Os cientistas acenderam o alerta diante do início da tramitação ambiental de um “megaprojeto” para produzir hidrogênio e amoníaco verdes por parte da empresa chilena AES Andes.
O projeto estaria localizado em Taltal, na região de Antofagasta, a entre cinco e 11 quilômetros de distância de Paranal, que abriga o Very Large Telescope, um dos instrumentos óticos mais poderosos do mundo. Junto dele está sendo construído o Extremely Large Telescope, com capacidade ainda maior.
“As emissões de poeira durante a construção, o aumento da turbulência atmosférica e, especialmente, a poluição luminosa, terão um impacto irreparável nas capacidades de observação astronômica”, advertiu o diretor-geral do ESO, Xavier Barcons, em comunicado.
Paranal foi inaugurado em 1999 e fica em pleno deserto de Atacama, o mais árido do mundo e lugar ideal para a observação astronômica por seu clima seco, grande altitude e ausência de nuvens e chuva.
O complexo é parte da rede de observatórios astronômicos que estão situados no Chile, entre eles o radiotelescópio Alma e o telescópio ótico de La Silla.
No fim de dezembro, a companhia AES Andes informou que o projeto inclui “a produção de hidrogênio e amoníaco verde, bem como o desenvolvimento de energia solar, eólica e de armazenamento em baterias”, em linha com o objetivo do Chile de ampliar a origem renovável de sua matriz energética.
A AES Andes foi procurada pela AFP, mas não fez comentários.
Para Itziar de Gregorio, representante do ESO no Chile, “é crucial considerar localidades alternativas para este megaprojeto que não coloquem em perigo um dos tesouros astronômicos mais importantes do mundo”.
Em outubro de 2024, entrou em vigor no Chile uma nova regra de luminosidade para proteger lugares próximos aos observatórios, mas também a saúde de pessoas e animais.
A normativa estabelece limites de luminosidade, horários máximos de funcionamento de telões publicitários, além de promover a transição para o uso de luz quente, que produz menos luminosidade.

author: AI Writer
title: Unveiling Soju's Cultural Significance with Lee JangWoo and Baek JongWon
text:
In a captivating episode of KBS 1TV’s documentary series ‘Documentary Insight’ titled ‘Soju Rhapsody,’ viewers explore South Korea’s beloved spirit: soju. Lee JangWoo, a prominent entertainment figure, shares his reflections on soju. He describes it as a drink that embodies life’s essence and diverse experiences.
The episode features Lee JangWoo enjoying a day of drinking with renowned chef Baek JongWon at a traditional restaurant in Euljiro. This experience goes beyond just consuming alcohol. For Lee, sipping drinks in beautiful locations feels like a vacation, bringing happiness. The joy of sharing moments over a glass of soju highlights its role in socializing and creating lasting memories.
Baek JongWon expertly discusses soju pairing, especially with pork belly. He notes that the sharpness of soju balances the richness of the meat, making it an ideal choice during hot summer months. This food knowledge enhances the drinking experience and showcases the cultural significance of drink combinations in Korean society.
Lee JangWoo delves into the unique cultural narrative surrounding soju, contrasting it with other alcoholic beverages like whiskey and wine. While whiskey and wine often have distinct production stories, soju reflects personal tales and shared experiences. It symbolizes celebration, especially after hard work, embodying the collective spirit of those who enjoy it.
The emotional connection to soju runs deep. Lee emphasizes its presence in daily life and social interactions. Soju becomes more than just a drink; it represents moments of joy and camaraderie. This bond between soju and personal narratives makes it significant in Korean culture, intertwining with the memories of those who partake in it.
Through ‘Soju Rhapsody,’ viewers appreciate the depth and richness of soju, not just as a beverage but as a vital part of the social fabric. As Lee JangWoo and Baek JongWon savor their drinks, they remind us that every sip is steeped in history, emotion, and the stories that define our lives.
Cultural Significance of Soju in Korean Society
- Soju Traditions: Soju has a long history in Korea, often linked to celebrations and gatherings.
- Soju Production: The process of making soju varies by region, leading to diverse flavors.
- Influence in Pop Culture: Soju frequently appears in Korean dramas and films, highlighting its importance in social interactions.
Engaging Insights from Lee JangWoo and Baek JongWon
- Lee JangWoo: "Soju is a part of my life; it tells my story."
- Baek JongWon: "Pairing soju with food enhances the entire dining experience."
By integrating these insights, we see how soju is more than just a drink; it connects people and enriches their lives. This deep connection to soju illustrates its role in Korean culture, making it a beloved spirit that continues to thrive.
topics: Arts, Culture and Entertainment->customs and tradition

author: @andaluciainf
title: Ampliado hasta las 12,00 horas la alerta roja por lluvias en el litoral de Huelva
text: La Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (Aemet) ha ampliado hasta las 12,00 horas de este viernes, 1 de noviembre, el aviso rojo por lluvias en el litoral de Huelva, mientras que en las comarcas de Aracena, Andévalo y Condado el aviso es naranja por lluvias y amarillo por tormentas. Así lo ha indicado el servicio de Emergencias de 112 Andalucía, que ha señalado que, igualmente está activo el nivel amarillo por lluvias en Sevilla hasta las 10,00 horas y pide "mucha precaución" a la población de ambas provincias andaluzas. Asimismo, desde la Diputación de Huelva han informado que la provincia se encuentra "por lluvias torrenciales", por lo que, ante esta situación, han destacado que "es obligado extremar las precauciones", no salir de casa y no usar el vehículo. La institución provincial ha señalado que municipios como Aljaraque ha registrado 150 litros por metro cuadrado, así como que "circunstancias similares" se dan en Cartaya, Gibraleón y Punta Umbría. Por ello, los efectivos del Consorcio Provincial Contra Incendios y Salvamentos de Huelva trabajan "de forma incansable" para "plantar cara a esta situación". La alerta roja, en principio establecida hasta las 09,00 horas, ha sido ampliada hasta las 12,00 horas del mediodía. Por su parte, desde el Ayuntamiento de Huelva han subrayado la capital ha vivido una noche de fuertes lluvias en la que los servicios de emergencias, en coordinación con Policía Local y bomberos, "han respondido perfectamente a las incidencias", y no hay que lamentar daños personales, y los materiales son "muy localizados". En este punto, el Consistorio ha apuntado que los trabajos preventivos en la ciudad han sido "clave" para evitar "efectos mayores", al tiempo que ha indicado que se mantiene activo el Plan de Emergencia Municipal en su nivel 1, y ha pedido "respetar las recomendaciones de seguridad y evitar toda salida innecesaria durante el resto de la jornada". De otro lado, el 112 ha informado de que las precipitaciones registradas durante las últimas horas en la provincia onubense han dejado 79 incidencias, donde el total de las contabilizadas durante el paso de la DANA asciende ya a 86 emergencias por anegaciones de sótanos, calles y viviendas de planta baja, en su mayoría en las poblaciones de Cartaya, Aljaraque, la capital y Punta Umbría. Asimismo, se han recibido también casos, aunque más aislados, en Lucena del Puerto, Gibraleón o Palos de la Frontera, entre otros municipios onubenses, según ha informado en un comunicado el Centro de Coordinación de Emergencias (Cecem 112), adscrito a la Consejería de la Presidencia, Interior, Diálogo Social y Simplificación Administrativa. Durante la madrugada, la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología (Aemet) ha activado el aviso rojo --riesgo extremo-- por observación de lluvias en las zonas de Andévalo, Condado y litoral onubense. Este aviso continuará en el litoral onubense hasta las 12,00 horas. Entre los avisos recibidos se cuentan anegaciones de bajos de hotel, residencia de ancianos y garajes en Huelva, mientras que en Punta Umbría una veintena de menores han quedado incomunicados en una casa de campo al verse afectado por las lluvias el camino de acceso. Las precipitaciones también están condicionando el tráfico en la H-30 debido a la acumulación de agua en el kilómetro 12 en la capital onubense. Envía tu noticia a: [participa@andaluciainformacion.es](mailto:participa@andaluciainformacion.es)

author: Web Desk
title: Actor Dodi Khan refuses to marry Rakhi Sawant
text:
Pakistani actor Dodi Khan refused to marry Indian actor-dancer Rakhi Sawant, days after his proposal.
To Read Lifestyle Stories in Urdu – Click Here
India’s controversy queen Rakhi Sawant has been left heartbroken once again, as Pakistani actor Dodi Khan, who proposed to her for a third marriage, earlier this week, has now refused to marry the ‘Main Hoon Na’ actor.
In his video message on the social site Instagram, Khan said on Thursday, “Hello India and Pakistan, this is Dodi Khan. Rakhi ji, you are my very good friend, and will always be but you cannot be my bride.”
“A few days ago, I had proposed Rakhi Sawant. I proposed to her because I have known her for a long time, she felt like a god-fearing person and a good human being,” he continued to explain. “She has been through a lot in her life. She lost her parents but was with them when they were ill, which is rare to see in today’s day and age. A guy came into her life and you all know what he did to her. She came out of that trauma. She accepted Islam, went for Umrah, and changed her name to Fatima. I liked that a lot that’s why I proposed to her.”
“But, I think that this is not acceptable to people because of the number of messages and the criticism that I have received, I cannot tolerate it,” he added. “So, Rakhi ji, you are my very good friend and will always be. But you might not be able to be my bride.”
View this post on Instagram
“However, I promise you that you will become the daughter-in-law of Pakistan. I will get you married in this country and to one of my Pakistani brothers,” he assured Sawant.
Reacting to his video message, Sawant was devastated and dropped several broken-heart and teary-eyed emojis in the comments section.
It is worth noting here that Sawant had been married twice previously.
She was married to Ritesh Raj Singh, with whom she participated in ‘Biss Boss 15’, for her third stint in the reality show. However, they parted ways soon after the show ended in February 2022. She then tied the knot with her ex-husband Adil Khan Durrani later the same year.
Also Read: Deedar, Nargis respond to Rakhi Sawant’s dance-off challenge

author: Staff Reports
title: Millsaps' throwing specialists named to 2025 SAA outdoor track & field All-Sportsmanship team
text:
CANTON, Ga. ( Millsaps Athletics ) — A pair of Millsaps men’s and women’s track and field student-athletes were named to the 2025 Southern Athletic Assocation Outdoor Track & Field All-Sportsmanship Team. Graduates AJ Alvarez and Tyler Hamby were chosen by the Millsaps coaching staff and their recognition was announced by the SAA office on Monday.
Formed in 2011, the SAA places a special emphasis on good sportsmanship and fair play amongst all competitors.
Alvarez appeared in five meets during the 2025 track and field outdoor season.
On March 14, he finished eleventh in the hammer throw, where he threw 28.24 meters at the Rhodes Invitational.
Improving on his talent, Alvarez extended his hammer throw distance to 32.53 meters on April 12, where he was the twelfth-place contender at the Rhodes 7-Way Meet.
Additionally, he notched one throw during the season in the discus (22.17 meters) at the Belhaven Invitational on March 22.
He also competed extensively with four throwing competitions in the shot put as a senior, recording his best toss at the 2025 SAA Outdoor Track and Field Championships. His toss of 10.10 meters was good for 17th position.
Working hard as a throwing specialist, Alvarez also completed his undergraduate studies with a 3.63 cumulative GPA and obtained his bachelor’s degree in biology during the 2025 Millsaps College Spring Commencement.
While on campus, he was a student assistant coach for the Millsaps football team in the fall and was a member of the Kappa Sigma Fraternity and Phi Beta Sigma Honor Society. Alvarez made the SAA Fall Academic Honor Roll all three seasons as a student-athlete for football and topped it off with a spot on the SAA Spring Academic Honor Roll his sole season with track and field.
Maintaining his focus outside of track and field, Alvarez devoted time to internships with Gretna Nutrition and HWY 23 Nutrition.
Hamby, also a member of the Millsaps women’s cross country team, added her name to the 2025 SAA Outdoor Track & Field All-Sportsmanship Team after showing a positive attitude towards her teammates and other competitors.
During the 2025 outdoor track & field season, Hamby appeared in three meets after overcoming an injury. The Courtland, Miss., native and javelin thrower finished runner-up at both the Rhodes 7-Way Meet (31.09 meters) on April 12 and at the Mississippi College Spring Classic (31.43 meters) on March 1.
Inside the classroom, Hamby garnered a 3.21 cumulative GPA and completed her bachelor’s degree in biology. She was also recognized during the 2025 Millsaps College Spring Commencement.
In the Fall of 2024, she became a member of Club 40 after boasting an impressive 4.0 GPA in her academic studies.
Hamby is a two-time member of the SAA Fall Academic Honor Roll for cross country and has made the President’s and Dean’s List.
While on campus, Hamby was a member of the Tri-Beta Honor Society and did research looking for endangered species of salamanders at Tishomingo State Park.
Hamby also helped manage Snowden Grove Baseball Park in Southaven, Miss., and was an assistant vet tech at South Panola Vet Hospital. After graduation she plans to attend graduate school to study veterinary medicine.
